text:
Hi.
I found the just a little bug in Apache HTTP server.

In http.conf file, ErrorDocument destroy tomcat's session value.
Especially, ErrorDocument somefilename.jsp, if error page is .jsp file i
couldn't use session values.
ErrorDocument only request htm(html) file for error page?

I couldn't find the bug in bug list, so I report this.   

I can't speek english well, please understand my english. Thank you.
creator: tori@contents-solution.co.kr
rbowen@apache.org
text:
If I'm understanding the situation correctly, you're talking about an error document on an HTTP server which is proxying through to a Tomcat server? Is this still a problem? (Yes, I know, no response for 4 years. Sorry.)

I wouldn't expect session variables to be something that the HTTP server would even have access to, in this context. Can you confirm that this is still happening in a recent version of the server, and that my understanding of the situation is correct.

creator: rbowen@apache.org
text: Moving docs bugs to docs@httpd.a.o ownership.

Closing as INVALID. Have not been able to confirm, either from bug submitter or various Tomcat users who say that this hasn't happened to them. Please reopen if you continue to think that this is a valid issue.
creator: rbowen@apache.org
